volume.title: Foreign Relations of the United States, 1981–1988, Volume XXXVIII, International Economic Development; International Debt; Foreign Assistance
Foreign Relations of the United States
International Economic Development; International Debt; Foreign Assistance
Volume XXXVIII

summary.tei:p: This volume is part of a subseries of volumes of the Foreign Relations series that documents the foreign policy decision making of the administration of President Ronald Reagan. This volume focuses on U.S. foreign economic policies toward and relations with the developing world from 1981 until 1988. It covers the formulation of U.S. foreign economic assistance and development policies, policies toward developing countries in the United Nations and at international meetings, the U.S. response to international debt problems, international commodity policy, and policies toward international financial institutions. As this volume takes a global and thematic approach, foreign economic policy issues related to a specific country or region are generally not documented in it, but instead are covered in regional and country-specific volumes within the subseries.
